headline.print_headline: High Gas Prices Give G.O.P. Issue to Attack Obama
headline.main: Rising Gas Prices Give G.O.P. Issue to Attack Obama

docs.snippet: The White House is preparing for Republicans to use the high cost of oil and gas to condemn the president’s policies on energy and the economy....
docs.abstract: Rising gasoline prices are causing concern among advisers to Pres Obama, who worry that a budding sense of economic optimism could be undermined just as he heads into the general election; White House officials are preparing for Republicans to use consumer angst about the cost of oil and gas to condemn Obama's energy programs and buttress their argument that his economic policies are not working.

byline.contributor: Binyamin Appelbaum and Annie Lowrey contributed reporting.

docs.lead_paragraph: The White House is preparing for Republicans to use the high cost of oil and gas to condemn the president’s policies on energy and the economy.

headline.print_headline: He Was a Knicks Pioneer, and He Has Proof
headline.seo: Another Knicks Pioneer — Brooklyn’s John Rucker
headline.main: He Was a Knicks Pioneer, and He Has Proof

docs.snippet: How John Rucker, a 1950 graduate of Brooklyn’s Erasmus Hall High, wound up preceding the Knicks’ first black player in training camp is not exactly clear, even to Rucker....
docs.abstract: How John Rucker, a 1950 graduate of Brooklyn’s Erasmus Hall High, wound up preceding the New York Knicks first black player in training camp is not exactly clear, even to Rucker; he will be honored by the Knicks at Madison Square Garden on what they are calling Pioneer Night in honor of Black History Month.
docs.lead_paragraph: How John Rucker, a 1950 graduate of Brooklyn’s Erasmus Hall High, wound up preceding the Knicks’ first black player in training camp is not exactly clear, even to Rucker.

headline.main: Patrick and Nascar Are Ready to Win

docs.snippet: As Danica Patrick moves from IndyCar and prepares to race full time in the Sprint Cup series in 2013, she appears at ease with the attention she has drawn....

keywords.value: National Assn of Stock Car Auto Racing
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: As Danica Patrick moves from IndyCar and prepares to race full time in the Sprint Cup series in 2013, she appears at ease with the attention she has drawn.

headline.print_headline: Palestinian’s Trial Shines Light on Military Justice
headline.seo: Palestinian’s Trial Shines Light on Justice System
headline.main: Palestinian’s Trial Shines Light on Military Justice

docs.snippet: As a grass-roots leader goes on trial, having been incriminated by a teenager, questions are being raised about the legal system Palestinians are placed into....
docs.abstract: Israel's military justice system is coming under increasing scrutiny for its often harsh, unforgiving methods of occupation in the West Bank; as a grass-roots Palestinian leader goes on trial, having been incriminated by a teenager, troubling questions are being raised about the legal system Palestinians are placed into; the Palestinian teen was pulled from his home at night and interrogated by the Israeli police, who pressed him to identify other youths and adult organizers of weekly protests in his West Bank village.
docs.lead_paragraph: As a grass-roots leader goes on trial, having been incriminated by a teenager, questions are being raised about the legal system Palestinians are placed into.

headline.print_headline: Push to Save Fighting Sioux Name Leaves North Dakota in Costly Limbo
headline.seo: Push to Save Fighting Sioux Name Puts N. Dakota in Costly Limbo
headline.main: Push to Save Fighting Sioux Name Leaves North Dakota in Costly Limbo

docs.snippet: The University of North Dakota has been preparing to drop its Fighting Sioux logo, but a petition drive to save the name has led to a confusing about-face....
docs.abstract: University of North Dakota has been preparing to drop its Fighting Sioux logo, but a petition drive to save the name has led to a confusing about-face; to comply with NCAA policy prohibiting Native American imagery, the university spent more than two years scrubbing references to the nickname and logo, including buying new uniforms and renaming its Web site and booster clubs; university officials have been forced to halt the transition, reverse it, then manage the consequences.
docs.lead_paragraph: The University of North Dakota has been preparing to drop its Fighting Sioux logo, but a petition drive to save the name has led to a confusing about-face.

headline.print_headline: Big Leaguers Who Aren’t Afraid of Getting a Little Dirty
headline.seo: Major League Groundskeepers Don’t Mind Getting Dirty
headline.main: Big-League Professionals Who Aren’t Afraid of Getting a Little Dirty

docs.snippet: Major league groundskeepers gathered in Anaheim, Calif., to talk shop, trade war stories and, like everyone else, worry about the weather....
docs.abstract: MLB groundskeepers gather in Anaheim, Calif, to talk shop, trade war stories and, like everyone else, worry about the weather; this is the 14th year that there has been a groundskeepers convention, and almost all of the 30 baseball teams are represented.
docs.lead_paragraph: Major league groundskeepers gathered in Anaheim, Calif., to talk shop, trade war stories and, like everyone else, worry about the weather.
